dataSetInformation.common:generalComment: This dataset represents a cradle-to-gate comparative LCA of five major methanol production pathways in China: Coal Gasification to Methanol (CGTM), Coal Coking to Methanol (COTM), Natural Gas to Methanol (NGTM), Biomass to Methanol (BOTM), and CO2 Capture/Hydrogenation to Methanol (CCTM). System boundaries include raw material extraction, resource inputs, emissions and outputs, but exclude infrastructure, capital goods, and methanol usage. Comprehensive inventories (inputs and outputs) are given for each route. The inventory data was sourced from plant data, national statistics, scholarly literature, and eFootprint LCA software/database. The methodology follows ISO 14040/44 and includes sensitivity analysis and midpoint/end-point LCIA per CML2001 and Eco-indicator 99. Notably, the environmental impact of electricity and steam inputs is a key sensitivity factor. The inventory omits inputs less than 1% by mass (cumulative omission <3%). Wastewater is treated and reused, solid waste is mostly landfilled locally, and waste catalyst is excluded due to long replacement cycle.

functionalUnitOrOther.functionalUnit: 1 tonne of purified methanol at plant gate (cradle-to-gate)

time.common:timeRepresentativenessDescription: Input and output data are representative of typical operating conditions and technology in China ca. 2020-2022; power grid mix reflects Chinese grid in 2022; local plant/project/literature data used whenever available, with simulation for emerging technologies (e.g., CCTM).
time.common:other: For CCTM, hydrogen electrolysis data is from typical recent literature data; for CGTM, synthesis and distillation use data from 2003 simulations; CCTM methanol synthesis is based on ChemCAD software simulation.

technologyDescriptionAndIncludedProcesse.#text: Five methanol routes are modeled: (1) CGTM (Coal Gasification to Methanol): includes coal mining/cleaning, Texaco coal-water slurry gasification, syngas purification (Rectisol), methanol synthesis (Cu/ZnO/Al2O3 catalyst), and distillation; (2) COTM (Coal Coking to Methanol): includes coal mining, pyrolysis (coke oven ~1100Â°C), gas cleaning, reforming, and methanol synthesis/distillation; (3) NGTM (Natural Gas to Methanol): natural gas extraction, processing (acid gas removal), steam reforming, syngas compression, methanol synthesis/distillation; (4) BOTM (Biomass to Methanol): biomass feedstock preparation, gasification (fluidized bed), syngas treatment, methanol synthesis/distillation; (5) CCTM (CO2 Capture/Hydrogenation to Methanol): electrolytic hydrogen (from water electrolysis using renewables), CO2 capture (amine scrubbing or direct air capture), syngas formation, and methanol synthesis/purification. System boundary excludes infrastructure, focusing only on foreground processes and immediate upstream supply chains. Wastewater is treated and reused; solid waste is sent to landfill. Waste catalyst excluded due to multi-year replacement cycle.

technologicalApplicability.#text: Applicable to China-based methanol production via mainstream and emerging routes. CCTM is in pilot/early commercialization; other processes reflect established industrial practice.

dataGenerator.common:other: Generated via Tiangong LCA automated workflow

matched_flows.general_comment: Coke Oven Gas (COG) is a strong fuel produced during the manufacture of metallurgical coke by heating bituminous coal to temperatures of 900Â°C to 1000Â°C in a chamber from which air is excluded. It is less useful compared to other injected fuels in the lower part of the blast furnace. As a coking product, COG is a combustible gas produced simultaneously along with coke and tar. The main constituents are, by volume, about 50% hydrogen, 30% methane and 3% higher hydrocarbons, 7% carbon monoxide.

matched_flows.general_comment: Hard coal refers to the coal whose high calorific value is greater than or equal to 24MJ / kg, including bituminous coal and anthracite. Because of its high calorific value and specific physical properties, hard coal has a wide range of applications in the industrial and energy fields, such as power generation, steel production, chemical raw materials and so on. The proportion of bituminous coal in hard coal is high, so hard coal is classified as hard coal-bituminous coal classification option.

matched_flows.general_comment: Coking coal, also known as main coking coal, is a kind of bituminous coal with high degree of metamorphism, which has strong caking and coking properties. Its dry ash-free volatile Vdaf is generally 10 % to 28 %, and the maximum thickness of the resin layer is y â¤ 25mm. Coking coal can produce colloids with good thermal stability when heated, and coke with large lumpiness, less cracks, high crushing strength and wear resistance can be obtained when coking alone.

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Methanol, also known as methyl alcohol and wood spirit, is the simplest aliphatic alcohol. It is an organic chemical with the formula CH3OH. Methanol was formerly produced by the destructive distillation of wood. It is a nondrinking type of alcohol used to create fuel, solvents, and antifreeze. It is a colorless, volatile, flammable liquid that is poisonous for human consumption. Methanol is a chemical building block for many everyday products and is also a clean energy resource.

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Alcohol-based fuels are used in automotive applications, particularly as high-octane fuels for racing cars. They burn more completely and thus produce lower emissions. Two types of alcohol are distinguished: ethanol and methanol. Ethanol is a fuel made from ethyl alcohol, commonly distilled from plant sources such as corn, grain, grass, and sugar. It can also be made from discarded newspapers and other organic substances. The plant materials used in its production are known collectively as biomass, making it a renewable, relatively eco-friendly fuel for vehicles.

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Methyl tert-butyl ether (MTBE), also known as tert-butyl methyl ether, is an organic compound. MTBE is a volatile, flammable, and colorless liquid that is sparingly soluble in water. It is primarily used as a fuel additive, blended into gasoline to increase its octane rating and knock resistance, and reduce unwanted emissions. It is a clear, colorless liquid with a low viscosity that is combustible and has a distinct, turpentine-like odor. It is miscible with organic solvents, but only slightly soluble in water.

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Separator paper refers to a type of paper designed to act as a barrier between layers of material, preventing them from sticking together or getting damaged. In the context of a Life Cycle Assessment data, the description may cover the treatment the paper has undergone, standards it complies with, its quality attributes, how it is used, the production route, and the raw materials input or educt name. Furthermore, it may include information on whether the paper is distributed as part of a production or consumption mix and detail its availability at specific locations such as to the consumer or at the plant.

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Coke, also known as metallurgical coke, is a solid fuel mainly composed of carbon. It is made by heating coal in a retort to a high temperature ( about 1000 Â° C ) and retorting under the condition of isolating air. This process is called coking, which is a chemical process of converting coal into coke. Coke has higher fixed carbon content and lower ash and sulfur content, which makes it have better reducibility and structural strength at high temperature. Coke is one of the indispensable raw materials in metallurgical industry because of its high calorific value, less and lasting flame during combustion.

unmatched_flows.general_comment: The product flow of coal gas involves the gasification of coal to produce a combustible gas mixture. This typically encompasses the processing and treatment of coal, compliance with relevant standards, quality control measures, end-use applications, and the production method, which usually involves partial combustion of coal in an oxygen-deficient atmosphere. Educt name for coal gas is typically coal. Moreover, the description implies whether the product is offered within a production mix or as a consumer-ready fuel, and the point of transfer, such as 'to consumer' or 'at plant'.

unmatched_flows.general_comment:
Gas oil refers to a fraction obtained by the fractional distillation of crude oil or other secondary processed oils in an oil refinery, with a boiling point range of 200-380Â°C. The gas oil distilled from the atmospheric tower is called atmospheric gas oil (AGO) or gas oil, and the gas oil obtained from vacuum distillation is called vacuum gas oil (VGO) or wax oil. It can be an intermediate distillate fuel containing certain heavy distillate oils for specific purposes.

Note 1: This distillate oil can be used for blending vehicle gas oil, heating oil, and marine distillate fuel.
Note 2: It refers to atmospheric gas oil (AGO) or vacuum gas oil (VGO) generally within the distillation range of 250Â°C to 500Â°C; VGO is also known as straight-run wax oil.
Note 3: The once-used term: gas oil.

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) is a product flow characterized by being a flammable mixture of hydrocarbon gases used as fuel in heating appliances, cooking equipment, and vehicles. It typically contains processing levels involving refining and condensation, adherence to safety and quality standards, and is commonly used as a heating source or automotive fuel. The production involves the separation and collection of gases during natural gas purification or oil refining, with educt names including propane and butane. It can be part of both production and consumption mixes and is available in cylinders or bulk for various sectors like domestic, commercial, and industrial 'to consumer', or 'at plant'.
unmatched_flows.process_name: Comparative cradle-to-gate LCA of methanol production technologies

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Metallurgical coke is a kind of solid fuel with high strength and high porosity, which is made of high quality coal at high temperature. Metallurgical coke plays the role of heat source, reducing agent and material column skeleton in the process of blast furnace smelting, and plays a vital role in metallurgical production. Since more than 90 % of the metallurgical coke is used for blast furnace ironmaking, blast furnace coke is often referred to as metallurgical coke.

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Conduction oil heating is indirect heating through the heat conduction oil in the refinery tank. It has a high energy consumption but offers high temperature control accuracy making it suitable for large scale operations. Conduction oil has a high boiling point and is usually used in industries that require temperatures of 150~350â instead of steam. The hot oil has high transfer efficiency fast heat transfer and good thermal stability.
unmatched_flows.process_name: Comparative cradle-to-gate LCA of methanol production technologies

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Coal based activated carbon, abbreviated as activated carbon, is a granular substance prepared from coal as a raw material. It has a very high internal porosity and specific surface area, and these pore structures can effectively adsorb and store gas, liquid, and solute molecules. The adsorption performance of activated carbon is attributed to its developed pore structure and high specific surface area, which can be applied in multiple fields such as water treatment, air purification, exhaust gas treatment, and solvent recovery.

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Solid carbon sources refer to materials that contain a high percentage of carbon and can be used for various applications, including as a source of energy, chemical synthesis, and metallurgical processes. Common solid carbon sources include coal, which is rich in carbon and the largest commercial source of mineral carbon, and biomass materials such as crop straw and fruit peel. unmatched_flows.general_comment: Abiotic Depletion Potential (ADP) is a method used in Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) to analyze the impact of an object on the world around it. It is the most widely accepted LCIA method. However, it has limitations such as neglecting resources that can be recycled. Depletion of abiotic resources is a disputed impact category in LCA due to different problem definitions and choices regarding parameters and data. The LCA results identified abiotic depletion potential for fossil fuels (ADPF) as key impact indicators.

unmatched_flows.general_comment:
Gas oil refers to a fraction obtained by the fractional distillation of crude oil or other secondary processed oils in an oil refinery, with a boiling point range of 200-380Â°C. The gas oil distilled from the atmospheric tower is called atmospheric gas oil (AGO) or gas oil, and the gas oil obtained from vacuum distillation is called vacuum gas oil (VGO) or wax oil. It can be an intermediate distillate fuel containing certain heavy distillate oils for specific purposes.

Note 1: This distillate oil can be used for blending vehicle gas oil, heating oil, and marine distillate fuel.
Note 2: It refers to atmospheric gas oil (AGO) or vacuum gas oil (VGO) generally within the distillation range of 250Â°C to 500Â°C; VGO is also known as straight-run wax oil.
Note 3: The once-used term: gas oil.

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Heavy crude oil (or extra heavy crude oil) is highly viscous oil that cannot easily flow from production wells under normal reservoir conditions. It is referred to as 'heavy' because its density or specific gravity is higher than that of light crude oil. Heavy crude oil has been defined as any liquid petroleum with an API gravity less than 20Â°. Heavy oil is a type of crude oil that is different from conventional crude oil insofar as they are much more difficult to recover from the subsurface reservoir.

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Wash oil is one of the light fractions extracted during the coal tar distillation process, which relies on optimizing the production mix at the plant. Wash oil plays a significant role in chemical and industrial applications, often used for aromatic hydrocarbon recovery or as a solvent. The products generated in the coal tar distillation process have a net calorific value of 33.453 MJ/kg, reflecting their economic potential for energy and material recovery.

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Methanol, also known as methyl alcohol and wood spirit, is the simplest aliphatic alcohol. It is an organic chemical with the formula CH3OH. Methanol was formerly produced by the destructive distillation of wood. It is a nondrinking type of alcohol used to create fuel, solvents, and antifreeze. It is a colorless, volatile, flammable liquid that is poisonous for human consumption. Methanol is a chemical building block for many everyday products and is also a clean energy resource.

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Landfill disposal refers to the process of managing and disposing of various types of waste, including municipal solid waste (MSW), construction and demolition debris (C&D), hazardous waste, and coal combustion residuals (CCRs or coal ash). Landfills are well-engineered facilities designed to protect the environment from contaminants present in the solid waste. They are built to hold a wide range of waste, from manufacturing and construction waste to agriculture waste. An industrial waste landfill includes all disposal areas at the facility.

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Syngas, or synthesis gas, is a mixture of hydrogen and carbon monoxide, in various ratios. The gas often contains some carbon dioxide and methane. It is principally used for producing ammonia or methanol. Syngas is combustible and can be used as a fuel. It is a key platform for the utilization of nonpetroleum carbon resources such as natural gas or shale gas and coal. Syngas can also be produced from renewable carbon feedstocks such as biomass and even CO 2.

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Waste impurities refer to toxic chemicals in waste that can be recovered through various methods such as solvent recovery and metals recovery. These impurities are removed in the Secondary Treatment stage for reuse. Advanced Treatment removes additional impurities and compresses the waste into a high-Btu gas. Wastewater treatment is another method of removing impurities from wastewater before it reaches aquifers or natural bodies of water. Impurities such as dirt, metal scrapings, water, or chemicals can get mixed in with used oil.
unmatched_flows.process_name: Comparative cradle-to-gate LCA of methanol production technologies

unmatched_flows.general_comment: A municipal solid waste landfill (MSWLF) is a discrete area of land or excavation that receives household waste. It may also receive other types of nonhazardous wastes, such as commercial solid waste, nonhazardous sludge, conditionally exempt small quantity generator waste, and industrial nonhazardous solid waste. A bioreactor landfill is a type of MSWLF in which liquids are added to help bacteria break down the waste.

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Fat coal is a kind of bituminous coal with moderate metamorphism. It is a kind of coking coal and has good cohesiveness. The dry ash-free base volatile Vdaf of fat coal is generally between 10 % and 37 %, the maximum thickness of the resin layer y is usually greater than 25 mm, and the Oya expansion degree b is greater than 150 % ( for bituminous coal with Vdaf greater than 28 %, b is greater than 220 % ). When the fat coal is heated, a large number of colloids can be produced. The coke produced when coking alone is good in melting, but there are more transverse cracks, and the coke root part has bee coke. The main use of fat coal is coking, and some high-ash and high-sulfur fat coal is also used for power generation. In coking, fat coal usually needs to be mixed with other coals to optimize the quality of coke.
unmatched_flows.process_name: Comparative cradle-to-gate LCA of methanol production technologies

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Raw coal refers to unwashed and unprocessed coal products mined from coal mines. 2.Raw coal will contain impurities such as coal gangue and pyrite during the mining process, and it needs to be screened and processed to remove these impurities to obtain hard coal ( bituminous coal / anthracite ) / lignite products. 3.Lignite accounts for about 13 % of China 's coal reserves, and hard coal ( bituminous coal, anthracite ) accounts for about 72.35 %, the proportion of bituminous coal in hard coal is high, so the raw coal is classified as hard coal-bituminous coal classification option.

It is a colorless, volatile, flammable liquid that is poisonous for human consumption. Methanol is a chemical building block for many everyday products and is also a clean energy resource.

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Coal gangue refers to the solid waste produced in the process of coal mining and washing. It is mainly composed of a mixture of carbonaceous, argillaceous and sandy shale, usually containing lower calorific value and higher ash content. The formation of coal gangue is related to the mining method, geological conditions and washing process of coal. It is a common by-product in the coal industry.

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Solid waste refers to materials regulated by the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act (RCRA) and includes both hazardous and non-hazardous waste. Under RCRA, only materials that meet the definition of solid waste can be classified as hazardous wastes. In 2018, about 146.1 million tons of municipal solid waste (MSW) were landfilled in the United States, with food being the largest component at about 24 percent, followed by plastics at over 18 percent, and paper and paperboard at about 12 percent. The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) defines solid waste as any material that is discarded and not subject to an exclusion or variance, which includes materials that are abandoned, recycled, or inherently waste-like. The EPA also provides information on best practices for waste management and has developed tools for identifying appropriate waste staging and storage.
unmatched_flows.process_name: Comparative cradle-to-gate LCA of methanol production technologies

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Electricity for thermal power is generated by thermal power plants using fuels such as oil, liquid natural gas (LNG), coal, and other substances. These plants burn fuels to create steam power that rotates generators, producing electricity. Thermal power generation is crucial for electricity supply due to its adaptability, reliability, availability, and economy of scale. Despite coal plants being phased out due to emissions, natural gas and biomass plants are on the rise.
unmatched_flows.process_name: Comparative cradle-to-gate LCA of methanol production technologies

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Energy, unspecified, can refer to various forms of energy that are not clearly defined or specified. This can include energy related to physical or mental states, such as fatigue or mental disorders, or energy in the context of resources, such as household energy insecurity or renewable energy sources. The term can also refer to energy in the context of scientific or technical fields, where it may be used when the specific type of energy is not identified.
unmatched_flows.process_name: Comparative cradle-to-gate LCA of methanol production technologies

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Primary energy (PE) is the energy found in nature that has not been subjected to any human engineered conversion process. It encompasses energy contained in raw fuels and other forms of energy, including waste, received as input to a system. Primary energy can be non-renewable or renewable. Primary energy is the energy that's harvested directly from natural resources. Sources of primary energy fall into two basic categories, primary fuels and primary energy flows.
unmatched_flows.process_name: Comparative cradle-to-gate LCA of methanol production technologies

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Hazardous solid waste is a term used in the hazardous waste management program. It is defined by the EPA's hazardous waste regulations under RCRA Subtitle C. This type of waste can cause substantial harm to human health and the environment if improperly handled. It can take the form of solids, liquids, sludges, or contained gases, and is primarily generated by chemical production, manufacturing, and other industrial activities. A solid waste derived from a hazardous waste is not considered hazardous when it no longer exhibits any characteristic of hazardous waste.

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Hazardous solid waste is a term used in the hazardous waste management program. It is defined by the EPA's hazardous waste regulations under RCRA Subtitle C. This type of waste can cause substantial harm to human health and the environment if improperly handled. It can take the form of solids, liquids, sludges, or contained gases, and is primarily generated by chemical production, manufacturing, and other industrial activities. A solid waste derived from a hazardous waste is not considered hazardous when it no longer exhibits any characteristic of hazardous waste.
unmatched_flows.process_name: Comparative cradle-to-gate LCA of methanol production technologies

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Methanol, also known as methyl alcohol and wood spirit, is the simplest aliphatic alcohol. It is an organic chemical with the formula CH3OH. Methanol was formerly produced by the destructive distillation of wood. It is a nondrinking type of alcohol used to create fuel, solvents, and antifreeze. It is a colorless, volatile, flammable liquid that is poisonous for human consumption. Methanol is a chemical building block for many everyday products and is also a clean energy resource.
unmatched_flows.process_name: Comparative cradle-to-gate LCA of methanol production technologies

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Waste impurities refer to toxic chemicals in waste that can be recovered through various methods such as solvent recovery and metals recovery. These impurities are removed in the Secondary Treatment stage for reuse. Advanced Treatment removes additional impurities and compresses the waste into a high-Btu gas. Wastewater treatment is another method of removing impurities from wastewater before it reaches aquifers or natural bodies of water. Impurities such as dirt, metal scrapings, water, or chemicals can get mixed in with used oil.
unmatched_flows.process_name: Comparative cradle-to-gate LCA of methanol production technologies

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Alcohol-based fuels are used in automotive applications, particularly as high-octane fuels for racing cars. They burn more completely and thus produce lower emissions. Two types of alcohol are distinguished: ethanol and methanol. Ethanol is a fuel made from ethyl alcohol, commonly distilled from plant sources such as corn, grain, grass, and sugar. It can also be made from discarded newspapers and other organic substances. The plant materials used in its production are known collectively as biomass, making it a renewable, relatively eco-friendly fuel for vehicles.

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Syngas, or synthesis gas, is a mixture of hydrogen and carbon monoxide, in various ratios. The gas often contains some carbon dioxide and methane. It is principally used for producing ammonia or methanol. Syngas is combustible and can be used as a fuel. It is a key platform for the utilization of nonpetroleum carbon resources such as natural gas or shale gas and coal. Syngas can also be produced from renewable carbon feedstocks such as biomass and even CO 2.

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Syngas, or synthesis gas, is a mixture of hydrogen and carbon monoxide, in various ratios. The gas often contains some carbon dioxide and methane. It is principally used for producing ammonia or methanol. Syngas is combustible and can be used as a fuel. It is used primarily in the production of hydrocarbon fuels, such as diesel fuel and methanol, and in the production of industrial chemicals, particularly ammonia.

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Solid waste refers to materials regulated by the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act (RCRA) and includes both hazardous and non-hazardous waste. Under RCRA, only materials that meet the definition of solid waste can be classified as hazardous wastes. In 2018, about 146.1 million tons of municipal solid waste (MSW) were landfilled in the United States, with food being the largest component at about 24 percent, followed by plastics at over 18 percent, and paper and paperboard at about 12 percent. The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) defines solid waste as any material that is discarded and not subject to an exclusion or variance, which includes materials that are abandoned, recycled, or inherently waste-like. The EPA also provides information on best practices for waste management and has developed tools for identifying appropriate waste staging and storage.

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Coal gasification is the process of producing syngasâa mixture consisting primarily of carbon monoxide (CO), hydrogen (H2), carbon dioxide (CO2), methane (CH4), and water vapour (H2O)âfrom coal and water, air and/or oxygen. The raw gas produced by the coal gasification technology is mainly composed of carbon monoxide (CO) and hydrogen (H2). It is a widely available technology used for hydrogen production, chemical raw material production, synthetic fuel production, as well as power generation.

unmatched_flows.general_comment: Coal gangue refers to the solid waste produced in the process of coal mining and washing. It is mainly composed of a mixture of carbonaceous, argillaceous and sandy shale, usually containing lower calorific value and higher ash content. The formation of coal gangue is related to the mining method, geological conditions and washing process of coal. It is a common by-product in the coal industry.
